text: Peter Runggaldier (born 29 December 1968 in Brixen and living in Sëlva, South Tyrol) is an Italian former Alpine skier, who specialized in downhill and super-G disciplines. He competed at the 1994 Winter Olympics and the 1998 Winter Olympics. ==Biography== Born in Sëlva, Italy, he won two World Cup races, as well as the Super-G World Cup in 1995. Today he controls the "Competition centre" of the Ski School of Selva. ==World Cup victories== {|class="wikitable" !Date !Location !Race |- |March 10, 1995 || Whistler||Super-G |- |March 3, 1996 || Happo One||Super-G |} ==See also== * Italian skiers most successful race winner ==References== Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:People from Sëlva Category:Sportspeople from Brixen Category:Italian male alpine skiers Category:Ladin people Category:FIS Alpine Ski World Cup champions Category:Alpine skiers of Fiamme Gialle Category:Olympic alpine skiers of Italy Category:Alpine skiers at the 1994 Winter Olympics Category:Alpine skiers at the 1998 Winter Olympics
title: Peter Runggaldier
